intro: Centaurea chrysolepis, commonly known as the golden beard, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its bright yellow flowers and hairy, lance-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is known for its hardy nature. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with composite flower heads. Centaurea chrysolepis is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens.
